page.description: Other settings for configuring controls in the FormView layout. These settings can be used to customize the style of controls in the layout.

description.p: One or more class names assigned to the wrapper element for the control. This property overrides the classes specified in the [Item class name] property on the *[ui:Form Properties]* tab.
To prevent any classes from being applied, specify *[ui:<None>]*.

Switch controls in the FormView layout can be customized using the *[ui:Item class name]* property. The class name assigned using the *[ui:Item class name]* property can be used in a CSS selector rule to modify the look and feel of a Switch. Switches in the FormView layout are assigned the default class names for the Switch control's Base sub-theme from the selected web theme. For the system Alpha theme, this means the Switch will be assigned the following class names:

item.name: switch
item.description: Class name assigned to the switch control

item.name: switchOn
item.description: Class name assigned when the switch is in the on state

item.name: switchDisabled
item.description: Class name assigned when the switch is disabled

item.name: switchInner
item.description: Class name assigned to the inner part of the switch

item.name: switchLeft
item.description: Class name assigned to the left part of the switch

item.name: switchRight
item.description: Class name assigned to the right part of the switch

item.name: switchButton
item.description: Class name assigned to the button part of the switch

description.p: Using a class assigned to the container for the FormView switch control via the *[ui:Item class name]* property, you can add *[extlink:CSS descendant combinator@https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Descendant_combinator]* rules to restyle the switches. For example, the CSS below changes the background and border colors for a switch control in a FormView when the class name "orange" is set in the *[ui:Item class name]* property.
